title: How to Make Tree Cutouts

steps.headline: Get the material that you want to make the tree out of.
steps.description: Green construction paper is a good example, or a thin cardboard sheet.

steps.headline: Draw a tree design onto the paper or card using a pencil.
steps.description: A design of a tree can be drawn freehand or you can copy the outline of a tree photo or template you find online.

steps.headline: Cut out the tree shape.
steps.description: Use a good pair of scissors to ensure that it's easy to cut.

steps.headline: Decorate in anyway you want.
steps.description: Add fruit, leaves, a singing bird, a squirrel in the trunk, some grass at the base, etc.

steps.headline: Obtain corrugated card.
steps.description: This can be found on some cardboard boxes, especially on the flaps. Or, it can be purchased from a craft store.

steps.headline: Draw a tree design.
steps.description: Draw freehand or use a template from online.

steps.headline: Cut out the tree.
steps.description: Use strong paper cutting scissors, to help you cut through the thicker layer of cardboard.

steps.headline: Decorate the tree.
steps.description: If the cardboard isn't a color you'd like the tree to be, color in the whole tree first. Then add detail colored parts, such as a singing bird, a bird's nest, leaves, blossom, fruit, etc. Consider gluing on cutouts such as apples, pears, oranges, etc. You can even add things such as buttons, ribbon, scrapbooking elements, etc.

steps.headline: Add a stand.
steps.description: This is optional but can be useful for if you want to display the tree in a classroom or your own room. Simply cut an elongated triangle from cardboard. Bend the wide end of the triangle back a little. Attach the bent part to the back of the tree, at the base. Have the rest of the length of the triangle sitting on the table or shelf, holding up the tree.

steps.headline: Select a piece of felt.
steps.description: Choose the color you want the tree to be as you won't be able to color the felt.

steps.headline: Find a suitable simple tree template.
steps.description: You can use a freehand drawing of a tree or you can copy or trace a template from the internet or a book. Cut out the template.

steps.headline: Place the template over the felt.
steps.description: Pin in place to stop it from moving when you cut out the tree shape.

steps.headline: Cut out the tree shape.
steps.description: Use sharp scissors suitable for fabric.

steps.headline: Decorate the tree.
steps.description: If you want to add fruit, blossom, birds, leaves, etc., decide how you'll do this. A very simple way is to glue on felt pieces cut to the shapes. A more imaginative way is to use things like buttons, ribbon, embroidered patches, etc. Glue or sew the items where you'd like.

steps.headline: Use the felt cutout tree on craft projects.
steps.description: Sew or glue the cutout tree to such projects as a quilt, blanket, toys, gift boxes, scrapbooks, etc. It can also be used for Christmas decorating if cut in the shape of traditional Christmas trees.

tyn: Scissors (paper or fabric, depending on the material)
Construction paper or thin cardboard; corrugated cardboard
Decorative elements such as glitter, buttons, ribbon, etc.
text: Construction paper cutout tree Get the material that you want to make the tree out of. Green construction paper is a good example, or a thin cardboard sheet. Draw a tree design onto the paper or card using a pencil. A design of a tree can be drawn freehand or you can copy the outline of a tree photo or template you find online. Cut out the tree shape. Use a good pair of scissors to ensure that it's easy to cut. Decorate in anyway you want. Add fruit, leaves, a singing bird, a squirrel in the trunk, some grass at the base, etc. Corrugated card tree cutout Obtain corrugated card. This can be found on some cardboard boxes, especially on the flaps. Or, it can be purchased from a craft store. Draw a tree design. Draw freehand or use a template from online. Cut out the tree. Use strong paper cutting scissors, to help you cut through the thicker layer of cardboard. Decorate the tree. If the cardboard isn't a color you'd like the tree to be, color in the whole tree first. Then add detail colored parts, such as a singing bird, a bird's nest, leaves, blossom, fruit, etc. Consider gluing on cutouts such as apples, pears, oranges, etc. You can even add things such as buttons, ribbon, scrapbooking elements, etc. Add a stand. This is optional but can be useful for if you want to display the tree in a classroom or your own room. Simply cut an elongated triangle from cardboard. Bend the wide end of the triangle back a little. Attach the bent part to the back of the tree, at the base. Have the rest of the length of the triangle sitting on the table or shelf, holding up the tree. Felt tree cutout Select a piece of felt. Choose the color you want the tree to be as you won't be able to color the felt. Find a suitable simple tree template. You can use a freehand drawing of a tree or you can copy or trace a template from the internet or a book. Cut out the template. Place the template over the felt. Pin in place to stop it from moving when you cut out the tree shape. Cut out the tree shape. Use sharp scissors suitable for fabric. Decorate the tree. If you want to add fruit, blossom, birds, leaves, etc., decide how you'll do this. A very simple way is to glue on felt pieces cut to the shapes. A more imaginative way is to use things like buttons, ribbon, embroidered patches, etc. Glue or sew the items where you'd like. Use the felt cutout tree on craft projects. Sew or glue the cutout tree to such projects as a quilt, blanket, toys, gift boxes, scrapbooks, etc. It can also be used for Christmas decorating if cut in the shape of traditional Christmas trees.
